title: FS: T206 Raw Collection New To Hobby 118 cards WaJo port Cy PB SLers Many Mid+ Grade
author: btcarfagno

posts.post_title: FS: T206 Raw Collection New To Hobby 118 cards WaJo port Cy PB SLers Many Mid+ Grade
posts.post_content:
Technically this is the same collection I started parsing up two years ago, as my consignor is looking to possibly sell the remaining cards as one lot. As a brief history, my consignor was a flea market dealer in the 1970's and early 1980's and built up this collection at that time. There are, therefore, no malicious trims if there are any trims at all which I highly doubt. About two years ago I opened the collection up selling it on Net54 on a card-by-card basis. Quite a few cards were purchased, some of which were subsequently graded with surprisingly better than expected results on the whole.

I try to be conservative with the grades that I show.

Highlights of the collection:

Jimmy Hart SL - Piedmont Back - about EX
Merritt - PB Back - About EX
Wiltse Pitching - PB Back - about EX
Manning Pitching - PB Back - about EX+
Doyle Batting - Tolstoi Back - about EX
Mordecai Brown  Portrait - Piedmont back - about VG/EX
Mordecai Brown Throwing - Sweet Cap back - about VG
Walter Johnson Portrait - Piedmont back - Looks VG/EX but has slightest surface wrinkle that may bring technical grade to 2.5 or 3
Cy Young Bare Hand - Sweet Cap back - about Fair
Cy Young Glove Shows - Polar Bear back - about GD/VG

Also HOFers valued in the $100-200 range including:

Marquard Portrait
Chance Chicago On Shirt
McGinnity
Marquard Hands At Things
Jennings One Hand
Huggins Hands At Mouth

Also, of the remaining commons and semi-stars, 70% are VG or better...some likely EX+.

Very few cards would grade poor or fair. Maybe 8 total out of the 118 cards. The rest are GD or better with 70% VG or better.

Backs are mostly Sweet cap and Piedmont with 16 Polar Bear, 3 Sovereign and one Old Mill (SLer).

Again, part of the value of this group is that you will know with 100% certainty that the cards are free of any possible malicious trimming. Because of the background of the cards and because more than half of this collection has already been sold to Net54 members and there were ZERO returns from those cards.

I am TAKING OFFERS for the lot. 

If you might be willing to MAKE ME AN OFFER on the lot (without asking "what are you looking to get") please PM me and I will send you a link with the scans and full list of cards available. 

Thanks for your time!
It would be tremendously helpful if we had even some sort of ballpark figure as to what the seller is looking for with this lot.
If someone reaches a deal for these and wants to sell the polar bears, I’d be interested. Thx.  Bob
Please resend the link. Or can someone forward me a working one?

Sorry. Link resent. Hopefully it works this time!

Tom C
